title: Inconsistent frame rate issues
body:
I have a decent pc; a beefy cpu with a good mid ranged graphics card.

I have always had a good consistent 120fps throughout all of my previous games.
But this patch has sent me down to the 5-10fps region. NOT FUN.
Problem is I have no idea how to fix it.
I've done everything on the League troubleshooting site, I have set my "priority" for the process up to high, I am running off SSD for the game. So what has happened?
I have no fps issues in any other games I have, so it seems to just be a league problem. I don't want to miss out for the ARURF weekend. 
I would like to use reinstalling league as a last resort preferably.

Any help is appreciated!

replies.body:
Windows 10’s Game DVR feature can slow your gaming performance by recording video in the background. If you don’t care about recording your gameplay, disable Game DVR for performance reasons.

Unfortunately, Game DVR takes system resources. On a slower computer–or if you just want maximum graphical horsepower for your games–it can noticeably slow your in-game performance and lower your FPS. If you don’t care about recording your gameplay, you’ll want to disable this feature. This Game DVR feature may or may not be enabled by default, depending on your PC’s hardware.

Please disable both Game DVR and Game Bar.

To disable Game DVR, head to Settings > Gaming > Game DVR. Ensure the “Record in the background while I’m playing a game” option here is set to “Off”.

To disable the Game Bar, head to Settings > Gaming > Game Bar. Set the “Record game clips, screenshots, and broadcast using Game bar” option here to “Off”.

Hope this helped :D.

I feel a bit silly now, I should have posted some specs with it xD

I'm on Windows 7 64bit professional
Nvidia 660 graphics card
SSD boot drive.
16GB ddr3 RAM

I fiddled with Nvidia settings to the extent I had to remove the drivers and clean install them x)

The only thing that seems to "resolve" (i say this because it doesnt actually fix the underlying issue) is to remove the framerate cap, let it go up to 200+ fps, then watch as it jumps down to 80-100fps.

EDIT: I turned the "arcade mode" visuals off, and it has restored about 20 of my fps. I'm still getting the inconsistency though. It seems like something is bottle-necking, but im not seeing any sort of spikes in performance from either the CPU or GPU

Hi there,

Thank you for your response.

So it seems turning off GAME DVR/BAR did no work for you. No worries, I am here to help you. Can I ask if you could go on your task manager (cntrl + alt + del) and tell me what is running in the process tab? 

Also, can you please try and right click on your League Of Legends and ensure that full screen optimisation is disabled.

Cheers
Swhyper
